title: Sevendust - Kill The Flaw (2015)192ak
description:
"Kill The Flaw", the eleventh studio album from SEVENDUST, can be streamed in its entirety below. Due on October 2 via 7Bros. Records with ADA/Warner Brothers distribution, the CD was produced by SEVENDUST and recorded at Architekt Music in Butler, New Jersey with engineer/mixer Mike Ferretti.

"Kill The Flaw" is available for digital pre-order at iTunes. Fans who order the album will receive an instant download of the first single, "Thank You".

Lajon Witherspoon recently told The Aquarian Weekly about the making of "Kill The Flaw": "The whole thing, to me, was such an experience and fun because we were able to take a break and unplug and to get that creative process within us when we went into the studio to do this album."

He continued: "We went in with this live effect. There wasnâ€™t anything really written for this album, so what we did was we set up on the live stage and everything was mic'd, from guitars to drums, so we were able to record while we were rehearsing pieces of songs. Then we would go in from 12 noon until 12 midnight and during the day, we would just get up there as the band SEVENDUST like when we started, which we loved to do, and just jam. Things came out and thatâ€™s the way this album, 'Kill The Flaw', came together, man. It was just like the beginning of our career when we sat down and jammed together like a band and it's what I think made this album flow so easily and come out with so many cool songs."

All songs written and composed by Sevendust. 

No. 	Title 	Length 	
1. 	"Thank You"   	4:27
2. 	"Death Dance"   	3:39
3. 	"Forget"   	4:15

7. 	"Chop"   	4:10
8. 	"Kill the Flaw"   	3:52
9. 	"Silly Beast"   	4:43
10. 	"Peace and Destruction"   	4:17
11. 	"Torched"   	3:20


    Lajon Witherspoon - lead vocals
    Clint Lowery - lead guitar, backing vocals
    John Connolly - rhythm guitar, backing vocals
    Vinnie Hornsby - bass guitar
    Morgan Rose - drums, backing vocals

	

Other

    Mike Ferretti - recording engineer, mixing engineer
    Kurt Wubbenhorst - keyboards and sound design
    Andy VanDette - mastering
    Frank Maddocks - artwork, layout design, photography
